headline: Ask HN: What are WhatsApp's privacy gray areas?
description:
> https://www.whatsapp.com/legal/privacy-policy-eea

Reading through these after reported recent update, I wasn't shocked to hear that location and usage patterns were deeply tracked and analysed. Much can be inferred, no doubt, from knowing the frequency and timings of messages.

They claim messages are never read, but also claim terms violations are investigated. They imply someone else complaining will send a screenshot, alleviating their need or ability to read messages directly. But in cases with no counterparty, maybe a police request, surely the only option is to have read access to message content? Or would the metadata be enough?

Then there's the section on constant contact book scanning and hashing of all numbers unknown to them. Fine, user convenience etc. and hopefully something that will cease to be an issue as the phone network dies off. But it's extremely valuable data, particularly when coupled with other meta property analytics. Not a major concern for me, but obviously a big no for anyone doing anything that needs serious operational security. Like politicians (facepalm).

My final concern was permanent access to photos and media. They say they encrypt media you share. They do not say they do not classify and analyse media you store for their own use. Is this possible, if one allows an app access to my camera/media, can it run ML classifier or other metadata analyses in the background?

I'm perhaps in a situation like many here where I'd much rather not use WhatsApp, but it's literally the only network in town for 99% of the local population. I'm a decade or more off of Facebook, never had an Instagram account, but I had to succumb to WA for kids, social and club activities, despite muddling along with Ubuntu phones, dumb phones and so on for years.

I'd love to get everyone on Signal, but that's obviously not happening.

Your thoughts on the grayer areas of WhatsApp's privacy policy and practices would be welcome.
headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: WhatsApp的隐私灰色地带是什么？
headline_zh-Hant: Ask HN: WhatsApp的隱私灰色地帶是什麼？
description_zh-Hans:
> https://www.whatsapp.com/legal/privacy-policy-eea

在报道了最近的更新之后，通过阅读这些内容，我并不感到震惊，因为我听说位置和使用模式被深入追踪和分析。毫无疑问，从了解信息的频率和时间可以推断出很多东西。

他们声称信息从未被阅读，但也声称对违反条款的行为进行调查。他们暗示其他投诉的人将发送截图，减轻他们直接阅读信息的需要或能力。但在没有对手的情况下，也许是警察的要求，唯一的选择肯定是对信息内容的阅读权限？或者元数据就足够了？

然后是关于不断扫描联系簿和对所有未知号码进行散列的部分。好吧，用户的便利等等，希望随着电话网络的消亡，这将不再是一个问题。但这是非常有价值的数据，尤其是在与其他元属性分析相结合的时候。对我来说，这不是一个主要的问题，但对任何需要严肃的操作安全的人来说，显然是一个大问题。像政治家（facepalm）。

我最后的担忧是对照片和媒体的永久访问。他们说他们对你分享的媒体进行加密。他们并没有说他们不会对你存储的媒体进行分类和分析，供他们自己使用。如果一个人允许一个应用程序访问我的相机/媒体，它是否可以在后台运行ML分类器或其他元数据分析？

我可能像这里的许多人一样，我宁愿不使用WhatsApp，但它实际上是当地99%的人口的唯一网络。我已经有十年或更长时间没有使用Facebook了，也没有Instagram账户，但为了孩子、社交和俱乐部活动，我不得不屈服于WA，尽管多年来一直使用Ubuntu手机、哑巴手机等。

我很想让所有人都使用Signal，但这显然是不可能的。

欢迎你对WhatsApp的隐私政策和做法的灰色领域发表看法。
